intro: Cincinalis scaberula, commonly known as the rough-stemmed cincinalis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture, contributing to its common name. Cincinalis scaberula is often found in humid climates and is known for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
